page.title: 01DENTON/WOOTTON/SWINGFIELD
page.content: The landscape is undulating Downland in west, high plateau in east. Land mainly cultivated for grain, rapeseed, corn for silage or pasturing for livestock. This is interspread with small woodlands which are periodically coppiced. Farmland in east consists of very large fields with no hedges and many woods cut sown. Main village of Denton north of Box 2, however, fuedal seat for Denton is Denton Court, a large house beside church, owner of which still owns large percentage of village. Wootton village, box 3, shop/post office has closed recently and there is only a public house/restaurant left. In box 4 is a motor racing track used most weekends. Selsted, a small hamlet, box 10, has a post office but Selsted Farm House has been seperated from its farmland. Main population in Wootton and are
